head.title: Alison W. Hunter Becomes the Bride Of Cary N. Potter Jr. in Connecticut

hedline.hl1: Alison W. Hunter Becomes the Bride Of Cary N. Potter Jr. in Connecticut

block.p: LEAD: Alison Webb Hunter and Cary Nicholas Potter Jr. were married yesterday at St. Mark's Episcopal Church in New Canaan, Conn., by the Rev. Roland M. Jones.
LEAD: Alison Webb Hunter and Cary Nicholas Potter Jr. were married yesterday at St. Mark's Episcopal Church in New Canaan, Conn., by the Rev. Roland M. Jones.
Alison Webb Hunter and Cary Nicholas Potter Jr. were married yesterday at St. Mark's Episcopal Church in New Canaan, Conn., by the Rev. Roland M. Jones.

Janet Jennings was the maid of honor, and Jennifer Potter was an attendant to her sister. Christopher Kingsland Potter, the bridegoom's brother, and Henry Hamilton Hunter Jr., the bride's brother, were the best men.
Mrs. Potter is a daughter of Mrs. Willard C. Mackey of New Canaan and Mr. Hunter of West Norwalk, Conn. Her husband is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Potter of Mill Neck, L.I.

The bride, 27 years old, graduated from New Canaan High School and Denison University. She is a client representative at Bloomberg Financial Markets, a financial information company in New York. Her father, who is retired, was a vice president of public relations at the Olin Corporation in Stamford, Conn. Her stepfather, also retired, was the chairman of the McCann-Erickson Worldwide advertising agency in New York. Her mother, Diane Mackey, is a painter and a jewelry designer.

The bridegroom, 26, is a graduate of St. Mark's School in Southborough, Mass., and Hobart College. He is a sales trader at Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette, investment bankers in New York. His mother, Clare Potter, is an artist. His father is the president of J. P. Morgan Investment Management in New York.
